problem: Given J is the midpoint of GI. J is the midpoint of FH and GI . Complete the proof that FG∥HI . (Elements:  FG ,  HI ,  ∠FJG ,  △HIJ ,  GJ ,  ∠FGJ ,  IJ ,  ∠HIJ ,  HJ ,  △FGJ ,  FJ ,  ∠HJI , )
statement: J is the midpoint of FH
J is the midpoint of GI
reason: Converse of Alternate Interior Angles Theorem
